(40720, 43198).name: land

(40720, 43198).label: location

(40720, 43198).label: location
(40720, 43198).description: The region of the Earth between the Tropic of Cancer and the Tropic of Capricorn, characterized by a generally warm and humid climate

(40720, 43198).name: phytoplankton
(40720, 43198).label: variable
(40720, 43198).description: Microscopic plant-like organisms that live in aquatic environments and play a crucial role in the ocean's carbon cycle

(40720, 43198).name: ocean acidification
(40720, 43198).label: natural hazard
(40720, 43198).description: The decrease in the pH level of the ocean over time, caused by the absorption of excess carbon dioxide from the atmosphere

(40720, 43198).name: primary productivity
(40720, 43198).label: variable
(40720, 43198).description: The rate at which plants and other organisms produce organic matter through photosynthesis, an important indicator of ecosystem health

(42721, 45332).name: ocean

(42721, 45332).label: location

(42721, 45332).name: surface chlorophyll
(42721, 45332).label: variable
(42721, 45332).description: A measure of the amount of chlorophyll present in the surface waters of the ocean, used as an indicator of phytoplankton productivity

(42721, 45332).name: interior suboxia
(42721, 45332).label: variable
(42721, 45332).description: A measure of the low oxygen levels in the interior of the ocean, often used to study oceanic biogeochemical processes

(42721, 45332).name: anthropogenic emissions
(42721, 45332).label: variable
(42721, 45332).description: The release of greenhouse gases and other pollutants into the atmosphere due to human activities, such as burning fossil fuels and deforestation

(42721, 45332).name: surface biogeochemistry
(42721, 45332).label: variable
(42721, 45332).description: The study of the chemical and biological processes that occur at the surface of the ocean, including the exchange of nutrients and gases between the ocean and atmosphere

(42721, 45332).name: atmosphere
(42721, 45332).label: location
(42721, 45332).description: The layer of gases that surrounds the Earth, playing a crucial role in the global climate system

(42721, 45332).name: denitrification
(42721, 45332).label: variable
(42721, 45332).description: The process by which microorganisms convert nitrate into nitrogen gas, often occurring in low-oxygen environments such as the ocean

(42721, 45332).name: global alkalinity
(42721, 45332).label: variable
(42721, 45332).description: A measure of the ability of the ocean to neutralize acids, often used to study ocean acidification and its impacts on marine ecosystems

(42721, 45332).name: surface nutrients
(42721, 45332).label: variable
(42721, 45332).description: The nutrients present in the surface waters of the ocean, such as nitrogen and phosphorus, that are essential for phytoplankton growth

(42721, 45332).name: CO2
(42721, 45332).label: variable
(42721, 45332).description: A greenhouse gas that plays a crucial role in the global climate system, often used as an indicator of climate change

(44919, 47085).name: atmosphere
(44919, 47085).label: location

(44919, 47085).name: ocean
